abbreviations - this pattern is written in us terminology st/sts stitch/stitches slip_stitch slip_stitch chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet inv decrease invisible decrease tools and materials - 5 mm crochet hook - bernat premium #4 worsted medium yarn - white and orange - yarn needle - stitch marker - safety eyes - scissors - stuffing final size - the diameter is 10 cm technical notes *most pieces are worked in spirals so use a stitch marker to indicate the start of a round *finish all pieces before attaching them together *make sure you stuff the head *insert the eyes before you close the head *at the end of each round is a stitch count in brackets *stitch count does not include chains and slip stitches head white round 1 make a magic_ring into the magic_ring make 6 single_crochet 6 sts round 2 make 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 sts round 3 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around 18 sts round 4 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next 2 sts repeat around 24 sts round 5-8 make 1 single_crochet in each st around 24 sts round 9 make 1 single_crochet inv decrease followed by 1 single_crochet in the next 2 sts repeat around 18 sts round 10 make 1 single_crochet inv decrease followed by 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around 12 sts round 11 make 6 single_crochet inv decrease 6 sts *insert eyes stuff and fasten_off leave a yarn tail to sew the head to the body wings white make two round 1 make a magic_ring into the magic_ring make 6 single_crochet 6 sts round 2 make 2 single_crochet in each st around 12 sts round 3 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next st repeat around 18 sts round 4 make 2 single_crochet in the first st followed by 1 single_crochet in the next 2 sts repeat around 24 sts *fasten_off and leave 20 cm of yarn you should have a circle fold in half and sew the edges
